intro: Pedicularis roylei var. cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a fine, grayish down, contributing to its common name. The species is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor environments, making it a unique and resilient member of alpine flora.
